comment._content: This photograph is taken looking from the ocean end of The Corso towards the harbour end. You could also compare it with a near-present day view which shows the retention of the late Victorian era shop fronts above awning level here: www.flickr.com/photos/michaelplonus/464754179/

comment.author: 99646599@N00
comment._content: Here is another link to a photo of the Corso, Manly that i took on 1/2/2008. www.flickr.com/photos/over_kind_man/2210127909/ Mike Vondran

comment.author: 39165494@N06
comment._content: This  view from the ocean beach end of Manly's Corso is a 'matching' photo with one taken from the Wharf/harbour end(note the Chinese? lanterns hanging from the shop awnings in both photos,perhaps as part of Manly's annual summer Venetian Carnival).

comment.author: 20958381@N08
comment._content: The American/Australian flags possibly are there for the celebrations of the arrival of the Great White Fleet on 20 August 1908 en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Great_White_Fleet
